vulnerabilities.title: Qwik has a potential mXSS vulnerability due to improper HTML escaping
vulnerabilities.description:
### Summary

A potential mXSS vulnerability exists in Qwik for versions up to 1.6.0.

### Details

Qwik improperly escapes HTML on server-side rendering. It converts strings according to the following rules:

https://github.com/QwikDev/qwik/blob/v1.5.5/packages/qwik/src/core/render/ssr/render-ssr.ts#L1182-L1208

- If the string is an attribute value:
    - `"` -> `"`
    - `&` -> `&`
    - Other characters -> No conversion
- Otherwise:
    - `<` -> `<`
    - `>` -> `>`
    - `&` -

vulnerabilities.title: builderio/qwik is vulnerable to code injection
vulnerabilities.description: Code Injection in GitHub repository builderio/qwik prior to 0.21.0. The Function deserializer can be accessed using the pureServerFunction feature. This allows any Javascript code to be run by node.js.

vulnerabilities.title: @builder.io/qwik vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting
vulnerabilities.description: @builder.io/qwik prior to version 0.16.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting due to attribute names and the class attribute values not being properly handled.
